description.message: Browser syncing as it should be: secure, anonymous and free!

introPanel1_Message.message:
Welcome

Thanks for using xBrowserSync!

Have a read through the following pages to help you get started. Should you require futher help, check out the FAQs.

introPanel2_Message.message:
Your secret word

To begin, enter a secret word or phrase that will be used to encrypt and decrypt your browser data.

Make it strong to protect your data but also memorable, if you forget it we can't remind you and you won't be able to decrypt your data without it.

introPanel3_Message.message:
Syncing for the first time

Once you've entered your secret word or phrase, you are ready to create a new sync. Just click the Sync button and your browser data will be encrypted before being synced to the xBrowserSync service.

And that's it, you're synced! Any future changes will be synced automatically in the background.

introPanel4_Message.message:
Your xBrowserSync ID

Every time you create a new sync you are given a new xBrowserSync ID, which can be found via the Settings panel.

You can use this ID along with your corresponding secret word or phrase to retrieve your synced data or sync on a different device.

introPanel5_Message.message:
Syncing to another service

When creating new syncs, by default your data is synced to the official xBrowserSync service, but you can change the service you sync to via the Settings panel.

You may do this because the service is full, offline, or perhaps you would like to run your own xBrowserSync service to sync your data to.

introPanel6_Message.message:
New service, new ID

IDs are service-specific. If you have created a sync and received an xBrowserSync ID with one service it cannot be used with another.

Whenever you change services you must create a new sync. You'll then receive a new ID for use with that service.

introPanel7_Message.message:
Use it or lose it

Service space is limited. If you do not use xBrowserSync for an extended period, any syncs you have created may be deleted to make room for others.

If you're synced, whenever you have your browser open xBrowserSync will sync regularly in the background which will prevent your sync from being deleted.

introPanel8_Message.message:
Searching your bookmarks

Once synced, all of your bookmarks will be available in the local browser which can be searched easily on the Search panel.

From there you can also modify or delete existing bookmarks. Just hover the mouse over a specific search result and click the pen icon to edit the bookmark.

introPanel9_Message.message:
Native features supported

Feel free to use your browser's native bookmarking features whilst synced, any changes you make there will be synced by xBrowserSync automatically.

If you have spent time organising your bookmarks don't worry, xBrowserSync will respect your existing bookmarks hierarchy!

introPanel10_Message.message:
Adding a bookmark

You can add the current page as a bookmark (or modify it if it is bookmarked already) by clicking on the bookmark icon in the Search panel.

Include a description which will be displayed in search results, and add tags to help find the bookmark more easily when searching.

introPanel11_Message.message:
Remember to back up

Back up and restore for your browser data is available via the Settings panel.

Back up saves your unencrypted browser data to a text file. Restore syncs your backed up data. If you are not currently synced, only local browser data will be affected.

introPanel12_Message.message:
When switching services

Back up your synced data using the first service before creating a new sync with the second, then restore your backed up data to the second service.

This will ensure that any bookmark descriptions and tags that are not supported natively by your browser are also synced.

introPanel13_Message.message:
Shortcut xBrowserSync

To access xBrowserSync quickly, assign a keyboard shortcut to activate the extension then just start typing to search your bookmarks.

Browse to chrome://extensions/, the keyboard shortcuts option is at the bottom of the page.

introPanel14_Message.message:
Noticed an issue?

If you've found a bug in xBrowserSync or would like to request a new feature, head on over to Git Hub and submit an issue.

Calling all coders! If you would like to help make xBrowserSync better, go ahead and fork the xBrowserSync Git Hub repo and submit a pull request.

confirmReplaceBookmarks_Message.message: xBrowserSync data will overwrite local browser data. OK to proceed?

syncBookmarksToolbarConfirmation_Message.message: Enabling syncing of the bookmarks bar will replace the bookmarks currently in the bookmarks bar with your synced bookmarks. OK to proceed?

cancelSyncConfirmation_Message.message: There is currently a sync in progress, if you proceed your local synced data will be incomplete. OK to proceed?

serviceStatus_NoNewSyncs.message: Online but not accepting new syncs

updateServiceUrlForm_Message.message: Enter the URL of an alternative xBrowserSync service. You can check the list of public xBrowserSync services here.

confirmUpdateServiceUrl_Message.message:
After changing the service, the current sync will be disabled and you'll need to create a new sync.

If you have previously created a sync using this service and would like to retrieve your data, you can use the xBrowserSync ID provided at the time. OK to proceed?

backupRestore_Message.message:
Back up your xBrowserSync data or restore from a previous backup.

If sync is not enabled, back up and restore will apply to local browser data only.

backupSuccess_Message.message: Your data has been backed up to {fileName}, check downloaded files for the location.

restoreForm_Message.message: Copy the contents of a backup file to restore data.

syncPanel_Message.message: Disable syncing changes to the bookmarks bar if you want to sync your bookmarks to multiple browsers but prefer their bookmarks bars to display different links.

confirmRestore_Sync_Message.message: As sync is currently enabled, the data being restored will overwrite your xBrowserSync synced data. To restore data to the local browser only, disable sync before restoring. OK to proceed?

confirmRestore_NoSync_Message.message: As sync is currently disabled, the data being restored will overwrite the local browser data. OK to proceed?

error_Default_Message.message: If the problem persists, submit an issue for the xBrowserSync team at https://github.com/xBrowserSync/App.

error_HttpRequestFailed_Message.message: Couldn't connect to the xBrowserSync service, check the service status in the Settings panel.

error_TooManyRequests_Message.message: Too many requests sent, sync has been disabled. Re-enable sync to resume syncing.

error_RequestEntityTooLarge_Message.message: Unable to sync your data as it exceeds the size limit set by the xBrowserSync service. Remove some old bookmarks and try again or switch to a different xBrowserSync service that allows for larger syncs.

error_NotAcceptingNewSyncs_Message.message: Unable to sync as this xBrowserSync service is not currently accepting new syncs. If you have already created a sync using this service enter your xBrowserSync ID, or change to an alternative service.

error_DailyNewSyncLimitReached_Message.message: Unable to create new sync as you have reached your daily new sync limit for this xBrowserSync service. Sync with an existing xBrowserSync ID, choose a different service or try again tomorrow.

error_NoDataFound_Message.message: Double check your xBrowserSync ID and secret and try again.

error_NoDataToRestore_Message.message: Ensure you have provided a valid xBrowserSync back up before restoring.

error_FailedGetLocalBookmarks_Message.message: An error occurred when trying to retrieve local bookmarks.

error_FailedCreateLocalBookmarks_Message.message: An error occurred when trying to create a local bookmark.

error_FailedRemoveLocalBookmarks_Message.message: An error occurred when trying to overwrite local bookmarks.

error_InvalidData_Message.message: Ensure your secret is identical to the one used when you created the sync for this ID.

error_LastChangeNotSynced_Message.message: The last change was not synced due to a bookmarks conflict. It would be a good idea to disable and re-enable sync before continuing.

error_BookmarkNotFound_Message.message: It looks like your bookmarks are out of sync. It would be a good idea to disable and re-enable sync before continuing.

error_OutOfSync_Message.message: Local data was out of sync but has now been refreshed. However, your last change was not synced so you will need to redo this change.

error_ContainerChanged_Message.message: Changing, deleting or moving xBrowserSync application folders can cause issues, sync has been disabled. Re-enable sync to restore bookmarks.

error_BrowserImportBookmarksNotSupported.message: Browser import bookmarks functionality is not supported in xBrowserSync. Create a new sync to sync your newly imported bookmarks.

error_NotImplemented_Message.message: A required function has not been implemented and is causing xBrowserSync to not function correctly.

error_SyncInterrupted_Message.message: A previous sync was interrupted and failed to complete. Re-enable sync to restore your synced data.
